Key Arguments: Misinformation and disinformation are considered opinions and should be protected under freedom of speech.
The public is capable of assessing opinions and making their own decisions without government intervention.
The proposed legislation would reduce freedom of speech.
The bill would give excessive power to authorities to determine what is true or false.
Notable Quotes: As long as there is freedom of speech, there is no misinformation and disinformation, these are just opinions of people which should be heard.
This bill will reduce our freedom of speech and will provide more power to the authorities who will decide what is 'true' and 'not true'.
